content: Scott Seto has professional experience building desktop and web applications with client and server-side technologies such as C#, .NET, WPF, JQuery, Javascript, Less and Knockout.
He utilized tools such as Visual Studio, VSTS, Microsoft Teams, Fiddler, Postman, and BrowserStack.
He is an active learner who enjoys absorbing new concepts and skills to benefit his team and others in the organization.
He enjoys utilizing other web development frameworks such as React JS, Vue JS, and Angular JS.
He has worked with SQL Server, MySQL, and SQLite databases.
Utilized the Aurelia web application framework to upgrade and revitalize WebSnak route accounting software that formerly relied on Java applets and servlets.
Enhance Sycamore route accounting mobile software utilizing Xamarin Forms by designing new pages and improving performance
Assist in the design of unit tests utilizing Selenium, Node JS, Nodemon, and Jenkins
First, worked as a tax software developer converting complex tax logic into C# code.
Worked in collaboration with tax analysts, tax client, and business services teams.
Built WPF desktop tools to promote developer productivity, and automatically review code.
Utilized the MVVM software pattern to help develop a tax model engine used by both online clients and tax professionals in branch offices.
Then, was promoted to the tax client team and worked to enhance the client-side Javascript engine used in DIY tax products.
Converted the ES5 engine using Gulp to an ES6 engine using Webpack.
Greatly improved its performance and reliability.
Utilized Jest to add unit tests to the development process to reduce the likelihood of runtime errors.
Implemented responsive web design principles to develop mobile-friendly web pages.
Hosted web sites with IIS7/Apache/Tomcat and provide troubleshooting services.
Created dynamic web sites using JSP, ASP.NET, PHP, CSS, JQuery and Javascript.
Handled web site data storage with SQL Server and MySQL.
Developed a web site for finding homes to sell or rent.
Developed a web site for designing 3-D shoes with Maya.
